head.title: The Model From VW Has Tires of Clay

hedline.hl1: The Model From VW Has Tires of Clay

block.p: AS it asking too much to expect that someone would spend $70,000 to $100,000 for a lump of brown clay with four wheels?
A life-size, two-ton clay model of the Volkswagen New Beetle (the real thing sells for $16,000 or so) went on the auction block at Christie's last week.
AS it asking too much to expect that someone would spend $70,000 to $100,000 for a lump of brown clay with four wheels?
A life-size, two-ton clay model of the Volkswagen New Beetle (the real thing sells for $16,000 or so) went on the auction block at Christie's last week.
Only a few people bid on the clay model, which was part of Christie's 20th century decorative arts sale, and those bids failed to reach critical mass.

''We had a few bids and they got close to our minimum bid requirement,'' Margaret Doyle, a Christie's spokeswoman, said. ''But it didn't sell. We are disappointed. A lot of people looked at it when it was on display in our gallery. It stood out, that's for sure.''
Ms. Doyle would not divulge the minimum bid requirement; the sale catalog listed it at about $70,000.
No full-size clay auto models are known to have been auctioned, Christie's said. More typically, the clay is reused or destroyed during the process of measuring for molds used in production.
The clay model will return to the Volkswagen Design Center in Wolfsburg, Germany, where it was produced in 1995.
